intro: Irvingbaileya, commonly known as the Hawaiian silversword, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hawaii. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its dense, silver-white foliage and a single, terminal flower head. The plant is adapted to the harsh, high-altitude environments of Hawaii's volcanic slopes. Irvingbaileya is a federally endangered species due to habitat loss and invasive species. Its unique morphology and ecological significance make it a valuable subject for botanical study.
